data.title: Uber driver recommended!
data.text: We walked to daily dose, about 100 yards from our hotel. It's situated right on the main drag and close to everything! We got a seat out on the patio and after we ordered, 3 of our friends joined us when they walked by. The service was great and laid back (added 3 people). Coffee is very good and comes in a huge mug. I got the crab cake eggs Benedict and my husband got the flannel hash Benedict with the seasonal butternut squash hash on the side. Mine was really good with a buttery hollandaise and flaky crabmeat. I think I liked my husband's better with the rye bread, corned beef, kraut, onions and a hit of jalepeno with that same rich hollandaise on top! Our other friend got the strip steak and eggs and said it was perfect! I would recommend this place as a laid back, boozy, tons of options on the menu breakfast spot. I liked that on the menu you could opt out of traditional "Benedict style" and swap with biscuits and gravy! Totally worth a try and only open breakfast and lunch! Roughly about $16/person.

data.title: Great breakfast 2 days in a row
data.text: My wife and I walked here from the hotel two mornings in a row for breakfast because the first day I couldn't choose between the Huevos Rancheros and the Southwest Hash.  Both were fantastic.  The food is plentiful and flavorful and the service is great.  My only complaint (and it probably applies to most places in AZ) is that they tend to keep it warm in the morning.  I suspect that as long as the temperature outside is around 80, they don't bother turning on the A/C.   This has really been the case most places we've been. Just something I imagine the locals are used to but we're not.

data.title: My husband is a fan; me not so much
data.text: Went for breakfast and it was okay. The coffee was descent. not bitter as in some places. My omelet was disappointing. I ordered the veggie omelet that supposed to come with asparagus and if there was any in there it must have been just a few flecks. What I wasn't expecting in it and really could have done without were green and red peppers which wasn't mentioned on the menu description. The best past of my meal was the butternut squash hash; very good, very tasty, cooked perfectly. I opted for a biscuit instead of toast and it was okay, I've certainly have had better, larger and flakier biscuits. These weren't much better than Pillsbury biscuits. My husband had something he thought was not only unique but delicious and spicy. He ordered the chorizo and jalapeno corncakes and loved it. He also ordered a tequila sunrise and thought it was excellent. My mother ordered the strawberries and creme waffle and the waffle was great, thick and perfect and very large, delicious; I tried it and it was very good. Could have been a 5 star waffle if it didn't have whipped cream from a can. Service was excellent, friendly and efficient especially considering how busy they were. I'm sure we will return considering how much my husband enjoyed it. I guess I'll just try something different next time.

data.title: Great food, great coffee, great service
data.text: Stumbled upon this restaurant while walking through old Town Scottsdale.  Menu is great with lots of options.  Definitely try pumpkin pancakes.  Lattes were amazing, don't go to the Starbucks next door for your coffee first.  If you do, you will definitely miss out on some of the best coffee in Scottsdale.

data.title: SO GOOD!
data.text: I've been to this place at least 10 times. Everything I've had is amazing! I highly recommend the campfire pancakes! So amazing. The atmosphere is fun too. This place also has alcoholic beverages to. Air for an extra fun Sunday funday!

data.title: Getting our DOSE of the Daily Dose
data.text: My wife and I found this place a couple of years ago and make it a MISSION to get back here every time we're in Scottsdale. Food is outstanding, fresh ingredients prepared in a VERY TASTY way. In a weeks time we've breakfasted here 3 times! Next time we're in Scottsdale we will make sure to get our DOSE of The Daily DOSE!!!

data.title: Good breakfast food with a twist
data.text: Good food, good service, and good ambiance.  Menu offered many options, a little different than the usual.  We had the breakfast nachos and huevos rancheros which were both delicious, and reasonable prices.   Good coffee, too.  It looks like a nice bar.  And they have outdoor seating.  All around a great place.

data.title: It was okay
data.text:
Honestly not much to write here.  Food was okay.  Nothing spectacular, but nothing bad either.  

Service was okay - sat at the bar with what appeared no designated waitress which made things a little more difficult - was never checked on and had to ask for coffee.

data.title: Just okay
data.text: The bacon was cooked too hard, biscuits and gravy was not your typically flavor. It was something that was obviously added to make it different or unique but I really didn't like it. Although I must say the portions are worth the money and the prices were not bad at all. The biscuits and gravy was loaded with sausage too. Would have been perfect if I enjoyed their "daily dose" spin. I would go again and try some other interesting options there menu offered.

data.title: Nailed It!
data.text: While staying in Old Town, we were looking for a good place for breakfast. DD was close by. It was awesome! Great food, great service, and just a fun place to be. We ate on the patio and just loved the whole experience! Will go back again before we leave, for sure!

data.title: Great brunch option
data.text: We had our group of 10 visit for brunch/lunch today and the menu had something for everyone. The staff prepared the table for us pretty quickly. I think we got lucky it wasnt too busy since it was a monday. I have heard it gets really busy on the weekends. After trying the food, I can see why. I got the burger with the pretzel bun and it was really good. Not the best I have eaten but it was definitely memorable. They are not open for dinner or later but they do have a small bar if you need to pop in for a drink or two while your significant other is shopping in the area or if that day of work warrants one during your lunch break. Very courteous and attentive staff.

data.title: Very crowded during peak season - you will wait
data.text: Good selection of healthy choices. Eggs benedict was hot and fresh. This is a good breakfast place if you can get in during peak season.

data.title: Good Breakfast and Service, Even Better Waiting Area
data.text:
There's multiple options at this restaurant to help satisfy almost any palette, especially healthy options like the ones we picked for breakfast.  The service was great during our whole visit and our server was very attentive.

One of the surprise highlights is that most any breakfast place in Scottsdale will have a waiting period on a weekend morning.  This place has outside seating available, BUT ALSO a station outside for coffee and water for guests to enjoy while waiting.  This is perfect to help pass the time, especially if it's warm and you just need something as simple as water.

Definitely worth coming back for a visit!!

data.title: Great breakfast and lunch
data.text: I have never had bad food from this restaurant. My favorite is the eggs Benedict, very good. Try it double d style for a change of pace. The atmosphere is similar to sitting in an industrial loft. The wait staff is nice and always friendly. One of my favorite places to go for breakfast.

data.title: Amazing breakfast food
data.text: It doesn't matter if you are a protein person, have a sweet tooth, or eat like a bird.  The Daily Dose is the place to go!  They have amazing breakfast nachos with egg and pulled pork on top.  The Strawberry Gingersnap Granola was pretty fabulous and the Banana Bread French Toast was too!  The coffee selections are insane.  The Choc-o-cheese coffee specialty drink was delicious.

data.title: totally made the Benedict correctly
data.text: i totally enjoyed the meal there with my family one Sunday morning.  the wait wasn't too long and the patio was a better choice as the restaurant was very noisy. It had been a while since a restaurant made my Benedict correctly, but it was wonderful.  i had the southwest style and it was very crispy with the corn tortillas and flavorful.  Mom and Trish enjoyed their meal as well.

data.title: Plenty, Creative and Good
data.text: Decided to treat myself to breakfast,something I rarely do so googled best places in Scottsdale.  Daily Dose came up as one and so glad I went with this one. Ordered the breakfast bacon omelet which came with avocado, tomato and cheese.  There was plenty of bacon and oozing cheese.  I asked to exchange some of the sides of potatoes and toast for a pancake.  Done!   A creative sauce of sour cream and rosemary was delicious and I used it to dip my avocado and side dish of fresh fruit.  Atmosphere and location are nice along with helpful service and pricing.

data.title: Love this place!
data.text: I tried this place for a business breakfast.  There were four of us and everyone loved their food.  The service was so amazing and we were not rushed at all.  There are a ton of choices and the food is really high quality.  There are lots of healthy options also.  They have great employees that are really well trained.  I can't wait to go back!

data.title: Good way to start the day
data.text: Good food and good coffee. I have been here a couple of times and have usually had to wait awhile for a table to free up, but the fare is worth a small wait

data.title: Fantastic breakfast
data.text: We stopped in here for breakfast and WOW! The food was great! The stuffed portabello mushroom is good and the fruit is so fresh. The protein pancakes were incredible! They were so big fluffy and stuffed with strawberries, bananas, blackberries, and blue berries to name a few. The service is top notch! This a great place to eat! I look forward to coming bar here for lunch or dinner one day.
